The records show that Ruth initially intended to go to college, but after two months she abandoned the idea because the student fare harmed her health. Once she gave up her own college plans, she concentrated on helping her sister Angeline financially so that Angeline could finish.

Ruth’s emotional connection to Angeline:  
Ruth acted “like a good angel” when Angeline collapsed six weeks before graduation, coming to McGrawville and taking her sister home to recover. The two kept in close touch: Ruth returned to McGrawville the next year and they arranged to board together, and Angeline’s letters urged Ruth to resume schooling so they could be “here a year together.”
